I am using a custom ant task from the Apache XMLBeans project, called xmlbean. I am starting it from the "External Tools..." menu in Eclipse 3.1, although it also happened in 3.0.  The OS is Fedore Core 4, and also occurred in Fedora Core 3.  Whenever the xmlbean task runs, the following appears on the console from which eclipse was started:

Exception in thread "Ant Build Server Connection"
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
        at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1768)
        at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.AntUtil.getLocationLink(AntUtil.java:491)
        at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.RemoteAntBuildListener.generateLink(RemoteAntBuildListener.java:255)
        at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.RemoteAntBuildListener.receiveTaskMessage(RemoteAntBuildListener.java:243)
        at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.RemoteAntBuildListener.receiveMessage(RemoteAntBuildListener.java:173)
        at
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.RemoteAntBuildListener
$ServerConnection.run(RemoteAntBuildListener.java:104) 

After this message, the build continues, but all output from the ant build vanishes, not appearing in the eclipse console view.  Running the same ant build from Eclipse in Windows produces all output as expected.  Likewise, running it from a linux command line works as I would expect.

There apparently is a problem with the xmlbean task code, but I think there is an eclipse issue in org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.AntUtil.getLocationLink as well.  When the error occurs, this function has just done:

			index = path.lastIndexOf(':');

On a String which has no ':'.  The subsequent:

		String fileName = path.substring(0, index);

causes the exception.

I think the function should check for a -1 value before doing the substring call to protect the RemoteAntBuildListener from termination.

This apparently should be closed as a duplicate of 102300
